intro: Heptapleurum clementis, commonly known as the African nettle, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is a member of the Urticaceae family, which includes many species of stinging plants. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its leaves are ovate to elliptic in shape, with a rough, hairy texture and prominent veins. The small greenish-white flowers are clustered in terminal panicles, and the plant is often found in moist, shaded forest environments.
